body.p: Table of contents are enclosed with the element <div type="contents">. A possible title is in the sub-element <head>. The single directory entries are organized in a list (<list>) with the respective chapter entries in <item> elements, the corresponding page numbers in <ref> elements:
body.codeblock: [title] [directory entry1/chapter name1] [page] [directory entry2/chapter name2] [page]
body.p: Tables of contents can be located in the introductory part of a volume and thus within the <front> element, or they can conclude a volume in which case they should be assigned to the <back> element. Tables of contents for individual books in a volume are eventually transcribed within the <text> element.

note.i: Alternative regulation phase 1: Typographical features (bold, italic, spaced etc.) of the table of contents in comparison to the continuous text as well as typographical variance within the table of contents are tagged with.
